Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an invoice.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.150-151)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87672) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87672)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 192 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
